entries.title: Meta sues “scraping-for-hire” service that sells user data to law enforcement
entries.description: Israeli firm says it uses AI to analyze “billions of ‘human pixels’ and signals.”

entries.title: Amid China’s massive COVID wave, 42% of people on one flight tested positive
entries.description: Another reminder to keep those masks on during flights.

entries.title: Best Buy offers free shipping for all members, but cuts Totaltech benefits
entries.description: Also, the points program will now be exclusive to Best Buy Credit Card holders.

entries.title: Ars is reviewing HBO’s The Last of Us series
entries.description: One critic who's played the games and one who hasn't—we're the original odd couple!

entries.title: Collector discovered Isaac Newton’s lost personal copy of Opticks
entries.description: David DiLaura called his discovery "a once-in-a-collector’s-lifetime event."

entries.title: Google to SCOTUS: Liability for promoting terrorist videos will ruin the Internet
entries.description: Supreme Court ruling could trigger “devastating spillover effects,” Google says.

entries.title: New Sony Walkman music players feature stunning good looks, Android 12
entries.description: Sony holds onto the beautiful dream of standalone portable audio players.

entries.title: Musk on trial for “funding secured” tweet—experts predict he’s going to lose
entries.description: Musk faces tough trial as judge already ruled his tweets were false and reckless.

entries.title: Amid widespread backlash, D&D maker scales back “open” license changes
entries.description: License will remain royalty-free, earlier OGL content will "remain unaffected."

entries.title: LG issues recall of 52,000 TVs due to 86-inchers’ “serious tip-over” hazards
entries.description: LG says the TVs are only a risk if you don't install the stand properly.

entries.title: Tesla drops prices up to 20 percent in attempt to drive sales
entries.description: The electric automaker is beginning to look a bit desperate for customers.

entries.title: Third-party Twitter clients are broken, whether by policy or glitch
entries.description: Developers find their apps "Suspended" or unresponsive, lack Twitter contacts.

entries.title: US vaccination decline continues: 250,000 kindergarteners vulnerable to measles
entries.description: Officials blamed a variety of factors, including pandemic disruptions and hesitancy.

entries.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook to take 40% pay cut this year
entries.description: CEO requested pay cut after shareholder vote on executive compensation.

entries.title: Batteries and hydrogen power these cute Toyota AE86 factory restomods
entries.description: The Toyota AE86 is beloved due to its role in the anime Initial D.

entries.title: Despite public stance, internal Exxon climate analyses were very accurate
entries.description: Exxon's scientists accurately projected things its executives didn't want to hear.

entries.title: New imaging finds trigger for massive global warming 56 million years ago
entries.description: 56 million years ago, hot magma scorched the sediments under the Atlantic seafloor.

entries.title: Rocket Report: Starship may actually be near liftoff; China’s copycat booster designs
entries.description: “This is not the outcome we were hoping for today."

entries.title: I disconnected from the electric grid for 8 months—in Manhattan
entries.description: What started as an experiment has turned into a habit I hope will inspire others.

entries.title: Vulnerability with 9.8 severity in Control Web Panel is under active exploit
entries.description: A patch was released in October, but not all servers have installed it.
